entry.title: Flying Back to China Under the Shadow of COVID-19
entry.content:
The global COVID-19 pandemic at the end of 2020 shows no signs of improvement.

And with the arrival of winter, there are signs of a resurgence.

But recently, Little Wizard needs to return to China.

Although various vaccines have been rolled out globally,

CompanyTypeDosageEfficacyStorage ‚ÑÉ
BioNTech/PfizermRNAx295%-70
ModernamRNAx295%-20
Oxford/AstraZenecaAdenovirus vectorx262-90%0

Currently, a 14-day quarantine is still required when returning to China.

Preparation

Visit the local embassy to obtain entry information.

For example, according to the Embassy of China in Singapore,

after October, the process for boarding a flight has gradually tightened and now requires:

  1. Nucleic acid testing
  2. Nucleic acid testing + Serum IgM double negative certificate
  3. Must apply for an epidemic prevention health code on WeChat Mini Program

Nucleic Acid Testing

In November, you still needed to make an appointment for testing, but in December, you can go directly to an approved hospital to get tested.

There happened to be a clinic near the apartment where Little Wizard lived, about a 5-minute walk away.

Since no appointment was required, there were a lot of people, and the wait was about an hour.

Blood was drawn and a nasal swab was taken.

Little Wizard had always been afraid of this test, but the doctors in Singapore were gentle and it wasn‚Äôt too uncomfortable.

A reminder here, you must press on the puncture site after getting blood drawn. The guy in front of me didn‚Äôt use a band-aid to hold down the puncture site.

As a result, blood flowed like a river, and there was blood on the floor and clothes. It was terrifying.

Health Code

The next morning, received a text message and email with the double negative certificate.

But the documents couldn‚Äôt be submitted on the WeChat Mini Program.

As a wizard, Little Wizard boldly guessed that it was a DNS resolution issue.

Cloudflare didn‚Äôt return the server IP of the Mini Program correctly.

By changing the mobile phone‚Äôs DNS to 114.114.114.114, the issue magically resolved.

Not only did it make Little Wizard wonder how non-wizards would deal with it,

one hour later, the health code was received.

Screenshots were saved just in case.

Protective Suit

Previously, people who returned to China were seen wearing full protective suits at the airport, which scared Little Wizard.

So, Little Wizard also bought a set of protective suit and adult diapers.

Trying them on secretly, they were not comfortable.

Considering that it was winter in the northern hemisphere at the end of the year, wearing a T-shirt on the plane in a tropical country would definitely lead to a heavy cold upon landing.

Wearing a protective suit and additional clothes would become a big problem.

After reading the CDC‚Äôs Domestic Travel During COVID-19 repeatedly, Little Wizard reasoned:

  • The plane has fresh air circulation.
  • Wear a mask.
  • Avoid touching eyes and nose.

The main mode of transmission of COVID-19 is through the respiratory system, so Little Wizard believes that wearing an N95 mask + surgical mask + goggles should be safe.

Return Flight

Currently, there are no direct flights from Singapore to Beijing.

The only option is to fly to Shanghai first and then transfer after a 14-day quarantine.

There are only three direct flights from Singapore to Shanghai per week.

Singapore Airlines on Mondays, Eastern Airlines on Thursdays, and Shanghais Airlines overnight on Fridays.

Eastern Airlines only allows one checked baggage, and excess baggage needs to be purchased separately, costing 500 RMB for each piece. Purchasing in advance on the app can get a 20% discount.

In addition to the health code, filling in the immigration form using the Customs Traveler mini program is also required before boarding.

Eastern Airlines

3:00 PM

Waiting at the boarding gate, about half of the people are wearing protective suits, tightly covered.

Actually, it was very awkward during the security check. Due to reasons like wearing a belt, some people had to take off their protective suits halfway.

Doesn‚Äôt this defeat the purpose? What‚Äôs the point of protection then?


Crew members also wear double-layered masks and goggles.

After the plane climbed, Little Wizard connected to satellite Wi-Fi and continued to update family members, so they wouldn‚Äôt worry.

Although there was a pandemic, there was still food service.

There weren‚Äôt many passengers, and there was no one on both sides of Little Wizard.

So, without waiting for the off-peak meal time, Little Wizard eagerly ate the snacks as soon as they were received.

The sister sitting by the window was fully wrapped up and didn‚Äôt eat, drink, or use the bathroom throughout the journey.

Impressive.

Rigorous Nucleic Acid Testing

9:30 PM

Checked the QR code before getting off the plane,
then took another nasal swab for nucleic acid testing.

Little Wizard said they were experienced and it didn‚Äôt matter.

The sister said that China is stricter, so she would try to be gentle.

First, she swabbed deeper than in Singapore, then swabbed several times.

Little Wizard thought it was over and made an OK gesture.

But unexpectedly, after a few seconds, the sister swabbed again in the opposite direction and put the swab in a test tube.

Little Wizard was about to say something, but the sister took out another swab,

swabbed the right nostril clockwise, paused, counterclockwise, and performed the same process.

Little Wizard held back tears and said thank you üôè

After all, it was late at night, and everyone was working hard.

Immigration

10:10 PM

Checked the entry form and passport.

The border officer flipped through a few visas and stamped it.

Then kindly reminded not to place the ID card next to the passport, as it could be demagnetized.

10:20 PM

Retrieved luggage, during the security check, reminded not to forget the luggage trolley.


10:30 PM

Shanghai local and non-local segregation


Nightmare

At this point, the nightmare of the entire journey began.

Because there were too many flights today, there was insufficient preparation for the quarantine buses üöå

Long wait started ‚åõÔ∏è

12:40 AM

Collected passports for registration.

Waiting and waiting, already very cold in Shanghai at midnight.

Fortunately, a friend from the National University of Singapore had bought a set of warm clothes for Little Wizard.

Wearing warm clothes, Little Wizard fell asleep while standing.

2:33 AM

Waiting, boarding the bus, the staff reminded that passports would be returned at the hotel.

Rocked on the bus, got on the highway.

Fell asleep again while enjoying the warm air.

Got off the highway, the bus stopped, wakes up and realizes that we had to wait for thousands of red lights even at midnight.

Go and stop, agonizing.

Because the quarantine hotel is randomly assigned, some are good and expensive, while others are cheap.

But at this point, Little Wizard didn‚Äôt care about saving money anymore, and just wanted a better hotel.

Please, give me a better hotel quickly üè®

International Spa Center

4:50 AM

Finally arrived at the quarantine hotel.

Looking up, it was a tall building, and by instinct, it seemed like a good hotel.

Checked the map, and it turned out to be a 5-star hotel as expected.

International Spa Center in Shanghai

Feeling delighted

Bad luck turned good

But still couldn‚Äôt get off the bus

Had to wait until the passengers on several buses in front finished checking in.

5:50 AM

Finally, got off the bus.

Passport and ID registration.

  • Hotel costs 350 RMB per day, various payment methods like Alipay, WeChat Pay, UnionPay.
  • Meals cost 100 RMB per day, but it‚Äôs not provided by the hotel, instead, it‚Äôs outsourced boxed meals.
  • Can also order take-out, delivered at 12:00 and around 6:00.
  • Can only receive packages, cannot send them out.
  • Temperature will be taken twice a day.
  • Seal the garbage bag and put it outside the door, and the staff wearing full protective suits will clean it regularly.

Check-in

6:10 AM

And thus, Little Wizard began the 14-day quarantine life.

Previously, Mom was worried that Little Wizard would get bored without being able to go out.

However, Little Wizard was already a homebody, and now legally didn‚Äôt have to see people, which made them very happy.

Besides, this place seems like the M Hotel where they stayed on their first trip to Singapore.


14-Day Quarantine

Of course, during the quarantine period, one cannot let their guard down.

Compared to tourists from the same country who have double negative certificates all the way,

in quarantine hotels, you might encounter people from various countries.

  • For example, on December 20th, there were 13 people who checked in for quarantine were diagnosed with COVID-19.
  • There was also a case where a person got sick on the 16th day after completing the 14-day quarantine.
  • Beijing has a 14+7 medical observation period.
  • The new strain of the coronavirus in the UK has a 70% increased transmissibility.
  • ‚Ä¶

Therefore, on one hand, open the windows ü™ü to ensure air circulation and reduce virus concentration.

On the other hand, wash hands üßΩ frequently, avoid touching eyes and nose üëÄüëÉ, and wear masks üò∑ properly.

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo
entry.summary:
The global COVID-19 pandemic at the end of 2020 shows no signs of improvement.

And with the arrival of winter, there are signs of a resurgence.

But recently, Little Wizard needs to return to China.

Although various vaccines have been rolled out globally,

Company Type Dosage Efficacy Storage ‚ÑÉ
BioNTech/Pfizer mRNA x2 95% -70
Moderna mRNA x2 95% -20
Oxford/AstraZeneca Adenovirus vector x2 62-90% 0

Currently, a 14-day quarantine is still required when returning to China.

entry.title: How to Open a US Stock Account
entry.content:
Referral code 0CM1QE

These days, the US election
As a novice investor, I won‚Äôt share because of the time difference and buying at high prices
Waking up in the middle of the night to a big drop and being forced to sell
Now I‚Äôm watching the stocks go up üöÄ, but I‚Äôm too embarrassed to enter the market

I‚Äôll just share my bitter experience of opening an account back then

US Brokers

Because many US brokers offer commission-free trades, I looked into them first

  • Robinhood (user-friendly interface)
  • TD Ameritrade (established)
  • Firstrade (Chinese customer service)

With Robinhood, both parties can receive free stocks with a referral code, so I asked a friend in the US for one. But then I found out that it can only be used within the US‚Ä¶
TD Ameritrade has an SG website, but after submitting the required documents, I got stuck at the last step and there was no response to my email inquiries
Firstrade automatically submits tax forms for non-US citizens. After submitting the required documents, it took a few business days for the account to be approved. Then I found out that only ACH, Check, and Wire Transfer are available for deposits.

ACH and Check require a US bank account for transfer, so they‚Äôre not possible
Wire Transfer incurs fees

Singapore Brokers

Then I researched Singapore brokers and found out that they use UOB or DBS bank‚Äôs trading account. I‚Äôve heard that the transaction fees are sky-high, not worth it

Domestic Brokers

Well, after going in circles‚Ä¶

  • Xiaomi‚Äôs Tiger Brokers
  • Tencent‚Äôs Futu
  • Xueqiu‚Äôs Snowball

I was quite happy that üêØ supports opening an account in Singapore

  • US stocks, Hong Kong stocks, Singapore stocks, Australian stocks‚Ä¶
  • Support pre-market and post-market trading, futures
  • Leverage

I was even planning to upload my passport and other documents, since I had them prepared beforehand
But then I found out that they support Singpass authentication, and it was quickly verified after a couple of redirects‚Ä¶

Oh my, if I had known it was this easy
Shouldn‚Äôt I have opened an account last year?

Otherwise, by now, it would have likely multiplied several times
Or maybe I would have jumped off a rooftop

Trading Fees

Because I don‚Äôt (dare to) trade options
Normal buy and sell transactions have three additional costs

  • $2 for buying
  • 0.1% of the total value of the stocks
  • $2 for selling

So even if you lose all your money, üêØ will still be overflowing with profits

Referral Code

You can use my code 0CM1QE

As for the current promotions, both parties can benefit from

  • 5 commission-free trades
  • Deposit $2000 SGD and get $30 SGD, deposit $30,000 SGD and get $100 SGD

Well, I have no desire to refer anyone

I remember that they used to give one share of Alibaba, maybe they can‚Äôt afford it anymore because the price has gone up too much?

Performance Report

Take a look at my performance report from these past two days of global stock market surges. I couldn‚Äôt sleep, worried and scared, but after some fearless actions‚Ä¶

So what are you waiting for? Register quickly

I‚Äôll be waiting for you on the rooftop~~~

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo

Referral code 0CM1QE

These days, the US election
As a novice investor, I won‚Äôt share because of the time difference and buying at high prices
Waking up in the middle of the night to a big drop and being forced to sell
Now I‚Äôm watching the stocks go up üöÄ, but I‚Äôm too embarrassed to enter the market

entry.title: How to Clean Dust and Fan on MacBook
entry.content:
If kernel_task is using a large percentage of your Mac CPU

I noticed that kernel_task would frequently reach 100% and cause my Mac to lag, but it is a System process and there‚Äôs nothing I can do about it.

According to Apple‚Äôs documentation If kernel_task is using a large percentage of your Mac CPU:

In other words, kernel_task responds to conditions that cause your CPU to become too hot, even if your Mac doesn‚Äôt feel hot to you. It does not itself cause those conditions. When the CPU temperature decreases, kernel_task automatically reduces its activity.

This means that because the CPU is too hot, even if it doesn‚Äôt feel hot to you‚Ä¶

Also, kernel_task isn‚Äôt the main culprit. Its usage will automatically decrease when the CPU temperature goes down‚Ä¶

I also found out that you shouldn‚Äôt charge your MacBook on the left side.

Here‚Äôs why you shouldn‚Äôt charge your MacBook Pro on the left side

While charging the MacBook Pro and having peripherals plugged in to the left-hand ports, the device‚Äôs ports can get hot; for some reason, this can result in kernel_task going a bit haywire and using up a whole boatload of system resources.

However, even after switching to charging on the right side for a few days, it still reaches 100% after a while.

Desperate‚Ä¶

Suddenly, I thought maybe it needs cleaning.

How to Clean MacBook Dust & Fan

I Googled and found out that you can do it yourself.
Mine is from 2016 and the warranty has already expired.
Otherwise, according to the Mac Warranty, it would be voided if I do it myself.

This Warranty does not apply:

  • (c) to damage caused by use a third-party component or product that does not meet the Apple Product‚Äôs specifications

Tools üîß

  • Pentagonal screwdriver
  • Dust blower, small brush
  • Discarded credit card üí≥

Steps

  1. Unscrew the screws
  2. Create a small gap on the side
  3. Insert the unused credit card üí≥ and slide it along the blue arrow direction shown in the diagram
    1. You will hear a click sound
    2. In Figure 2, you can see a row of four card slots along the middle horizontal line
    3. Be careful not to break anything (hopefully üòì)
  4. Slide the üí≥ symmetrically on the right side as well
  5. Then, pull horizontally with force following the red arrow
    1. Figure 2 shows slots above the fan
    2. So you need to exert horizontal force, gently pulling left and right ‚ÜîÔ∏è symmetrically
  6. The back cover will open


It is indeed extremely dirty.


After cleaning the dust, kernel_task doesn‚Äôt appear as often, and the üíª is revived.
I suddenly feel like my 2016 MacBook can last for another 5 years. üë®‚Äçüíª

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo
entry.summary:
If kernel_task is using a large percentage of your Mac CPU

I noticed that kernel_task would frequently reach 100% and cause my Mac to lag, but it is a System process and there‚Äôs nothing I can do about it.

According to Apple‚Äôs documentation If kernel_task is using a large percentage of your Mac CPU:

In other words, kernel_task responds to conditions that cause your CPU to become too hot, even if your Mac doesn‚Äôt feel hot to you. It does not itself cause those conditions. When the CPU temperature decreases, kernel_task automatically reduces its activity.

This means that because the CPU is too hot, even if it doesn‚Äôt feel hot to you‚Ä¶

Also, kernel_task isn‚Äôt the main culprit. Its usage will automatically decrease when the CPU temperature goes down‚Ä¶

entry.title: iOS Token-based APNs
entry.content:
Apple has provided a new method (authentication token) for APNs.

Compared to the previous method (provider certificate), the certificate *.p12 expires every year.

Token-based *.p8 never expires.

  • Establishing a Token-Based Connection to APNs
  • Communicating with APNs

For clients

The only difference for the client is

  1. Create an authentication token signing key on https://developer.apple.com/
  2. Download the *.p8 and send it to the backend engineer.

For the backend

Many frameworks support *.p8.

For example:

Firebase

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo
entry.summary:
Apple has provided a new method (authentication token) for APNs.

Compared to the previous method (provider certificate), the certificate *.p12 expires every year.

Token-based *.p8 never expires.

entry.title: The Graveyard Book
entry.content:
The Graveyard Book üé†

Children have no concept of life and death. To them, the graveyard is more like an amusement park.

Thank you üôè üêº to the reader who sent me another book.

To be honest, the number of books I‚Äôve read has dropped drastically since I went abroad. From a few hundred books a year before, it has now become only a handful.

I used to proudly say that reading should be driven by interest and not for any reward. Now, it‚Äôs a complete contradiction.

But there are also objective reasons:

Firstly, most of the books I want to read now have original versions. Since there are original versions available, I don‚Äôt really want to read the translated versions.

Secondly, one time when I was on the phone, I was overheard by a friend from NUS (National University of Singapore). Afterwards, she repeatedly mocked me, saying ‚Äúyour plastic English.‚Äù

But I have my stubbornness, even though I‚Äôm slow, I still insist on reading the original version. I should be able to speed up one day, just like with Chinese books.

Thirdly, my county is an island. It‚Äôs not as beautiful and lonely as you all great people have said about foreign countries. And during the initial period of the outbreak, I once thought that this place was a paper-developed country. It‚Äôs summer all year round here, except it‚Äôs a bit hot, everything else is pretty comfortable. Blue sky, white clouds, rainstorms, thunder and lightning. It feels like time has frozen, which is quite nice.

Without any ulterior motives, naturally I lost the motivation to read.

Now that there‚Äôs a Circuit Breaker, I finally have some time and mood to read.

When I first received this book, I thought it was science fiction. When I heard it can make one invisible, I thought it was fantasy. When I encountered a girl, I thought it was a love story. When I went to school, I thought it was a campus story. When my dad came to the scene to bring someone back, I thought it was about family. When the whole family was killed, I thought it was a mystery. In the end, it turns out it‚Äôs about growing up.

Just as the author wrote at the end:

I finished the sixth chapter, ‚ÄúBod‚Äôs School Days,‚Äù in a run-down hotel in New Orleans, USA. I completed the last page in my own garden gazebo, fighting back tears as I wrote. Only at that moment did I understand why I didn‚Äôt write this book when I had just become a father. Because before I could start creating, I needed to accompany my children through their growing years, nurture them, love them, and finally learn to let go.

Also, it was difficult to immerse myself in the story while reading. The whole book gave me a feeling of a Harry Potter knockoff.

But there was one obvious difference in this reading experience. When I used to read such novels before, it would often be from the perspective of the protagonist. But as I‚Äôve grown older, this time it was more from Silas‚Äô perspective.

If this book followed the usual fantasy routine in China, Bod would definitely have gotten the girl, Scarlett, tamed Sleer, become the Master, fought with Jack, and become the leader of the Brotherhood.

However, none of this happened in Neil‚Äôs American Gods. After Bod defeated the monsters üëæ, the girl was actually scared off, and Bod just had an ordinary thought of ‚Äúthe world is so big, I want to go and see.‚Äù

As a father, do you hope to see your own Bod become the typical one in China or the one in the book üìñ?

There are also some stupid things done during rebellious periods that parents have to bear the consequences for. Now that I‚Äôm older, I understand the difficulties and reasons behind the various prohibitions my parents imposed back then.

But thinking about it, there‚Äôs no solution. My younger self didn‚Äôt know the things that I know now.

I once imagined if my present self could have a conversation with my past self, my past self definitely wouldn‚Äôt have obediently listened. I would have to be hit by society‚Äôs iron fist in the face to wake up and realize, and resolutely do certain things.

After dealing with everything, there will come a day when we have to step out of the realm of fairy tales and enter real life.

‚ÄúGood-bye, then, Silas.‚Äù Bod held out his hand, as he had when he was a small boy, and Silas took it, in a cold hand the color of old ivory, and shook it gravely.
‚ÄúGood-bye, Nobody Owens.‚Äù
Bod picked up the little suitcase. He opened the door to let himself out of the crypt, walked back up the gentle slope to the path without looking back.

When I left, I was in a more miserable state. No one sent me off, no goodbyes. I got my deposit back from my apartment in Beijing, bought a one-way ticket, and packed everything into three suitcases. At 4 a.m., I took a taxi to the airport. After checking in, boarding, I just left.

without looking back

How I wish I had heard Bod‚Äôs imaginary voice at that moment:

He took a step forward‚Ä¶ a voice said, ‚ÄúI am so proud of you, my son.‚Äù

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo
entry.summary:
The Graveyard Book üé†

Children have no concept of life and death. To them, the graveyard is more like an amusement park.

entry.title: How to Reduce iCloud Storage by Shrinking Videos
entry.content:
In fact, removing unnecessary segments from 4k videos can be a more effective way of saving space.

When I view videos in the ‚ÄúPhotos‚Äù gallery, it shows me when and where I took them.

This is a great feature that helps me reminisce my memories. However, the original 4k videos take up too much space in iCloud.

For example, even with HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding), a 2:30 video will take up 1GB of space. My 200GB iCloud plan is almost full.

Therefore, I plan to compress the videos slightly to save some space.

But,

FFmpeg video conversion loses GPS even with metadata

Luckily, I found a solution.

Tools

  • FFmpeg
  • Exiftool

Export the original videos to a folder

A common method to export videos from ‚ÄúPhotos‚Äù to a folder is to have ‚ÄúPhotos‚Äù convert the videos.

Therefore, you must select all the videos you want to export and then go to:

File -> Export -> Export Unmodified Original For...

Shrink each video

The default stream for iPhones is:

#0:0(und): Video: hevc (Main) (hvc1 / 0x31637668), yuv420p(tv, bt709)

So re-encoding with -pix_fmt yuv420p10le (10-bit) doesn‚Äôt help.

You can then copy and paste this code into the Terminal, navigate to the VideoFolder using cd VideoFolder, and then run shrinkVideos.

The shrinking process will take a long time.

On my MacBook Pro (15-inch, 2018), it takes only 0.3x longer. But in general, the videos will be reduced by 5x without too much loss of quality.

Once everything is done, the shrunken videos will be in the shrunk/ folder.

You can then compare them, delete the original videos, and import the shrunken videos.

Okay, at last I couldn‚Äôt stand the slow speed, so I used Nvidia 1080 GPU for acceleration. To learn more, visit: CUDA GPU Accelerated h264/h265/HEVC Video Encoding with Staxrip.

Next step is to tag the converted videos as hvc1, otherwise, an error will occur when importing the photos:

Invalid: The operation couldn‚Äôt be completed. (PHPhotosErrorDomain error -1.)

So the whole step is:

Hope this helps you.

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo
entry.summary:
In fact, removing unnecessary segments from 4k videos can be a more effective way of saving space.

When I view videos in the ‚ÄúPhotos‚Äù gallery, it shows me when and where I took them.

This is a great feature that helps me reminisce my memories. However, the original 4k videos take up too much space in iCloud.

For example, even with HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding), a 2:30 video will take up 1GB of space. My 200GB iCloud plan is almost full.

Therefore, I plan to compress the videos slightly to save some space.

entry.title: LeetCode Linked List
entry.content:
Design Linked List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúDesign Linked List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It creates a class called MyLinkedList which implements the functionality of a linked list.

Linked List Cycle

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúLinked List Cycle‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which checks whether a linked list contains a cycle.

Linked List Cycle II

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúLinked List Cycle II‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which finds the node where the cycle begins in a linked list.

Intersection of Two Linked Lists

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúIntersection of Two Linked Lists‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which finds the intersection node of two linked lists.

Remove Nth Node From End of List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúRemove Nth Node From End of List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which removes the nth node from the end of a linked list.

Reverse Linked List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúReverse Linked List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which reverses a linked list.

Remove Linked List Elements

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúRemove Linked List Elements‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which removes all elements of a linked list that have a certain value.

Odd Even Linked List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúOdd Even Linked List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which rearranges a linked list such that all the odd nodes come before the even nodes.

Palindrome Linked List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúPalindrome Linked List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which checks whether a linked list is a palindrome.

Merge Two Sorted Lists

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúMerge Two Sorted Lists‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which merges two sorted linked lists into a single sorted linked list.

Add Two Numbers

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúAdd Two Numbers‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which adds two numbers represented as linked lists.

Flatten a Multilevel Doubly Linked List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúFlatten a Multilevel Doubly Linked List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which flattens a multilevel doubly linked list.

Insert into a Cyclic Sorted List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúInsert into a Cyclic Sorted List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which inserts a node into a cyclic sorted list.

Copy List with Random Pointer

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúCopy List with Random Pointer‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which creates a deep copy of a linked list with random pointers.

Rotate List

This is the solution for the ‚ÄúRotate List‚Äù problem on LeetCode. It contains a class called Solution which rotates a linked list to the right by k places.

Translated by gpt-3.5-turbo
